data.title: "Midday Sorrow" (1932) - Angel Planells (1901-1989) - Art Institute of Chicago - 10 Jan 2015 - 125
data.meta_description: Angel Planells was an artist from the Catalan region of Spain, and was influenced by Salvador Dali and Rene Magritte. This painting was first shown at the First International Surrealist Exhibition at the Burlington Galleries in London in 1936, where it was purchased by Roland Penrose, one of the exhibitions organizers.
data.text: Angel Planells was an artist from the Catalan region of Spain, and was influenced by Salvador Dali and Rene Magritte. This painting was first shown at the First International Surrealist Exhibition at the Burlington Galleries in London in 1936, where it was purchased by Roland Penrose, one of the exhibitions organizers.
